intro: Cryptolepis bifida, commonly known as the split-leaved cryptolepis, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bifid (split) leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Cryptolepis bifida is often found in moist, shaded habitats and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
